item.name: Aeolipile
item.text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Aeolipile: Aeolipile deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
item.flavorText: "Although fragile, the Aeolipile could be quite destructive." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. I

item.name: Armor Thrull
item.text: {T}, Sacrifice Armor Thrull: Put a +1/+2 counter on target creature.
item.flavorText: "They gave their lives to strengthen the Order's armies, until they declined this honor in favor of joining the Thrull Rebellion." —Jherana Rure, Counter-Insurgency Commander

item.name: Armor Thrull
item.text: {T}, Sacrifice Armor Thrull: Put a +1/+2 counter on target creature.
item.flavorText: "They gave their lives to strengthen the Order's armies, until they declined this honor in favor of joining the Thrull Rebellion." —Jherana Rure, Counter-Insurgency Commander

item.flavorText: "They gave their lives to strengthen the Order's armies, until they declined this honor in favor of joining the Thrull Rebellion." —Jherana Rure, Counter-Insurgency Commander

item.flavorText: "They gave their lives to strengthen the Order's armies, until they declined this honor in favor of joining the Thrull Rebellion." —Jherana Rure, Counter-Insurgency Commander

item.name: Balm of Restoration
item.text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Balm of Restoration: Choose one — You gain 2 life; or prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
item.flavorText: "Not all armies enjoyed the services of a medic. For them, Balm of Restoration was that much more valuable." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. I

item.name: Basal Thrull
item.text: {T}, Sacrifice Basal Thrull: Add {B}{B} to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: Although my later designs were much more sophisticated, Basal Thrulls were no less a success." —Endrek Sahr, "Thrulls"

item.text: {T}, Sacrifice Basal Thrull: Add {B}{B} to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: Although my later designs were much more sophisticated, Basal Thrulls were no less a success." —Endrek Sahr, "Thrulls"

item.name: Bottomless Vault
item.text: Bottomless Vault enters the battlefield tapped. You may choose not to untap Bottomless Vault during your untap step. At the beginning of your upkeep, if Bottomless Vault is tapped, put a storage counter on it. {T}, Remove any number of storage counters from Bottomless Vault: Add {B} to your mana pool for each storage counter removed this way.

item.name: Brassclaw Orcs
item.text: Brassclaw Orcs can't block creatures with power 2 or greater.
item.flavorText: "The large brass claws worn by some Sarpadian Orc tribes were among the least feared weapons ever known." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

item.name: Brassclaw Orcs
item.text: Brassclaw Orcs can't block creatures with power 2 or greater.
item.flavorText: "The large brass claws worn by some Sarpadian Orc tribes were among the least feared weapons ever known." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

item.name: Breeding Pit
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Breeding Pit unless you pay {B}{B}. At the beginning of your end step, put a 0/1 black Thrull creature token onto the battlefield.
item.flavorText: The Thrulls bred at a terrifying pace. In the end, they overwhelmed the Order of the Ebon Hand.

item.name: Combat Medic
item.text: {1}{W}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
item.flavorText: "We'd no sooner knock 'em back on their heels than that accursed sawbones would show up and patch 'em back together again." —Ivra Jursdotter

item.name: Combat Medic
item.text: {1}{W}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
item.flavorText: "We'd no sooner knock 'em back on their heels than that accursed sawbones would show up and patch 'em back together again." —Ivra Jursdotter

item.flavorText: "We'd no sooner knock 'em back on their heels than that accursed sawbones would show up and patch 'em back together again." —Ivra Jursdotter

item.name: Conch Horn
item.text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Conch Horn: Draw two cards, then put a card from your hand on top of your library.
item.flavorText: Even the most skilled of modern mages only partially understand the Conch Horn's awesome powers.

item.name: Deep Spawn
item.text: Trample At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Deep Spawn unless you put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard. {U}: Deep Spawn gains shroud until end of turn and doesn't untap during your next untap step. Tap Deep Spawn. (A permanent with shroud can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

item.name: Delif's Cone
item.text: {T}, Sacrifice Delif's Cone: This turn, when target creature you control attacks and isn't blocked, you may gain life equal to its power. If you do, it assigns no combat damage this turn.
item.flavorText: "Where is it written that beasts must cause pain?"Delif, Ponderings

item.name: Delif's Cube
item.text: {2}, {T}: This turn, when target creature you control attacks and isn't blocked, it assigns no combat damage this turn and you put a cube counter on Delif's Cube. {2}, Remove a cube counter from Delif's Cube: Regenerate target creature.

item.name: Derelor
item.text: Black spells you cast cost {B} more to cast.
item.flavorText: "Strength it has, but at the cost of a continuous supply of energy. Such failure can bear only one result." —From the execution order for Endrek Sahr, Master Breeder

item.name: Draconian Cylix
item.text: {2}, {T}, Discard a card at random: Regenerate target creature.
item.flavorText: "There is no gain without sacrifice." —Icatian proverb

item.name: Dwarven Armorer
item.text: {R}, {T}, Discard a card: Put a +0/+1 counter or a +1/+0 counter on target creature.
item.flavorText: "The few remaining pieces from this period suggest the Dwarves eventually made weapons and armor out of everything, even children's toys." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

item.name: Dwarven Catapult
item.text: Dwarven Catapult deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among all creatures target opponent controls.
item.flavorText: "Often greatly outnumbered in battle, Dwarves relied on catapults as one means of damaging a large army." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

item.name: Dwarven Hold
item.text: Dwarven Hold enters the battlefield tapped. You may choose not to untap Dwarven Hold during your untap step. At the beginning of your upkeep, if Dwarven Hold is tapped, put a storage counter on it. {T}, Remove any number of storage counters from Dwarven Hold: Add {R} to your mana pool for each storage counter removed this way.

item.name: Dwarven Lieutenant
item.text: {1}{R}: Target Dwarf creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "Dwarven officers were tireless in battle, moving up and down the lines to rally their troops and boost morale." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

item.name: Dwarven Ruins
item.text: Dwarven Ruins enters the battlefield tapped. {T}: Add {R} to your mana pool. {T}, Sacrifice Dwarven Ruins: Add {R}{R} to your mana pool.

item.name: Dwarven Soldier
item.text: Whenever Dwarven Soldier blocks or becomes blocked by one or more Orcs, Dwarven Soldier gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "Although the Dwarves staunchly defended their walled city-states against the Orcs, their civilization was the first to fall, and its name was sadly lost." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. I

item.name: Dwarven Soldier
item.text: Whenever Dwarven Soldier blocks or becomes blocked by one or more Orcs, Dwarven Soldier gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "Although the Dwarves staunchly defended their walled city-states against the Orcs, their civilization was the first to fall, and its name was sadly lost." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. I

item.name: Ebon Praetor
item.text: First strike, trample At the beginning of your upkeep, put a -2/-2 counter on Ebon Praetor. Sacrifice a creature: Remove a -2/-2 counter from Ebon Praetor. If the sacrificed creature was a Thrull, put a +1/+0 counter on Ebon Praetor. Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.

item.name: Ebon Stronghold
item.text: Ebon Stronghold enters the battlefield tapped. {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool. {T}, Sacrifice Ebon Stronghold: Add {B}{B} to your mana pool.

item.name: Elven Fortress
item.text: {1}{G}: Target blocking creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "Thallids are not ordinary enemies of flesh and bone and reason. They attack with no thought for our strength or of their own losses. I fear our Fortresses shall be overwhelmed." —Kyliki of Havenwood

item.flavorText: "Thallids are not ordinary enemies of flesh and bone and reason. They attack with no thought for our strength or of their own losses. I fear our Fortresses shall be overwhelmed." —Kyliki of Havenwood

item.name: Elven Lyre
item.text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Elven Lyre: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: Scholars are uncertain whether it was the actual sound or some other magical property of the Elven Lyre that transformed its player.

item.name: Elvish Farmer
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Elvish Farmer. Remove three spore counters from Elvish Farmer: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield. Sacrifice a Saproling: You gain 2 life.

item.name: Elvish Hunter
item.text: {1}{G}, {T}: Target creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
item.flavorText: "As the climate cooled, many Elves turned to Thallid farming for food, while the Hunters honed their skills on what little game remained." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. III

item.name: Elvish Hunter
item.text: {1}{G}, {T}: Target creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
item.flavorText: "As the climate cooled, many Elves turned to Thallid farming for food, while the Hunters honed their skills on what little game remained." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. III

item.name: Elvish Scout
item.text: {G}, {T}: Untap target attacking creature you control. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by it this turn.
item.flavorText: Although the Elves of Havenwood lived in isolated villages, their swift communications allowed them to act as a single community.

item.flavorText: Although the Elves of Havenwood lived in isolated villages, their swift communications allowed them to act as a single community.

item.name: Farrelite Priest
item.text: {1}: Add {W} to your mana pool. If this ability has been activated four or more times this turn, sacrifice Farrelite Priest at the beginning of the next end step.
item.flavorText: Although their methods were often brutal, Farrel's followers believed in the preservation of justice and virtue.

item.name: Farrel's Mantle
item.text: Enchant creature Whenever enchanted creature attacks and isn't blocked, its controller may have it deal damage equal to its power plus 2 to target creature. If that player does, the attacking creature assigns no combat damage this turn.

item.name: Farrel's Zealot
item.text: Whenever Farrel's Zealot attacks and isn't blocked, you may have it deal 3 damage to target creature. If you do, Farrel's Zealot assigns no combat damage this turn.
item.flavorText: After the fall of Trokair, Farrel and his followers formally broke their ties with the rest of Icatia.

item.name: Farrel's Zealot
item.text: Whenever Farrel's Zealot attacks and isn't blocked, you may have it deal 3 damage to target creature. If you do, Farrel's Zealot assigns no combat damage this turn.
item.flavorText: After the fall of Trokair, Farrel and his followers formally broke their ties with the rest of Icatia.

item.name: Farrel's Zealot
item.text: Whenever Farrel's Zealot attacks and isn't blocked, you may have it deal 3 damage to target creature. If you do, Farrel's Zealot assigns no combat damage this turn.
item.flavorText: After the fall of Trokair, Farrel and his followers formally broke their ties with the rest of Icatia.

item.name: Feral Thallid
item.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Feral Thallid.
Remove three spore counters from Feral Thallid: Regenerate Feral Thallid.
item.flavorText: "Born and bred of fungus, Thallids were nearly impossible to kill." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. I

item.name: Fungal Bloom
item.text: {G}{G}: Put a spore counter on target Fungus.
item.flavorText: "Thallids could absorb energy from the forest itself. Even Elves were at a disadvantage in fighting them." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. III

item.name: Goblin Chirurgeon
item.text: Sacrifice a Goblin: Regenerate target creature.
item.flavorText: "I asked one of my aides how they do it, but all he'd say was, ‘Trust me, Mayor, you don't want to know.'" —Lydia Wynforth, Mayor of Trokair

item.name: Goblin Chirurgeon
item.text: Sacrifice a Goblin: Regenerate target creature.
item.flavorText: "I asked one of my aides how they do it, but all he'd say was, ‘Trust me, Mayor, you don't want to know.'" —Lydia Wynforth, Mayor of Trokair

item.text: Sacrifice a Goblin: Regenerate target creature.
item.flavorText: "I asked one of my aides how they do it, but all he'd say was, ‘Trust me, Mayor, you don't want to know.'" —Lydia Wynforth, Mayor of Trokair

item.name: Goblin Flotilla
item.text: Islandwalk At the beginning of combat, unless you pay {R}, whenever Goblin Flotilla blocks or becomes blocked by a creature this combat, that creature gains first strike until end of turn.
item.flavorText: Exceptionally poor sailors, Goblins usually arrived at their destination retching and in no condition to fight.

item.name: Goblin Grenade
item.text: As an additional cost to cast Goblin Grenade, sacrifice a Goblin. Goblin Grenade deals 5 damage to target creature or player.
item.flavorText: "Without their massive numbers, the Goblins could never have launched such a successful offensive." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. VI

item.name: Goblin Grenade
item.text: As an additional cost to cast Goblin Grenade, sacrifice a Goblin. Goblin Grenade deals 5 damage to target creature or player.
item.flavorText: "Without their massive numbers, the Goblins could never have launched such a successful offensive." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. VI

item.flavorText: "Without their massive numbers, the Goblins could never have launched such a successful offensive." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. VI

item.name: Goblin Kites
item.text: {R}: Target creature you control with toughness 2 or less gains flying until end of turn. Flip a coin at the beginning of the next end step. If you lose the flip, sacrifice that creature.

item.name: Goblin War Drums
item.text: Each creature you control can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.
item.flavorText: "Defending the outer trenches, we strained our eyes in the darkness. All we could hear was the Drums' terrible pounding. Dobbs, on my right, broke first. Soon, we were all heading for the walls." —Corporal Peter Douglas, courtmartial testimony

item.name: Goblin Warrens
item.text: {2}{R}, Sacrifice two Goblins: Put three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.
item.flavorText: "Goblins bred underground, their numbers hidden from the enemy until it was too late." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

item.name: Hand of Justice
item.text: {T}, Tap three untapped white creatures you control: Destroy target creature.
item.flavorText: "The Hand of Justice will come to cleanse the world if we are true." —Oliver Farrel

item.name: Havenwood Battleground
item.text: Havenwood Battleground enters the battlefield tapped. {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool. {T}, Sacrifice Havenwood Battleground: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool.

item.name: Heroism
item.text: Sacrifice a white creature: For each attacking red creature, prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by it this turn unless the attacking player pays {2}{R}.

item.name: High Tide
item.text: Until end of turn, whenever a player taps an Island for mana, that player adds {U} to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).
item.flavorText: "By the time their enemies noticed the sea's changing mood, the Vodalians had often shifted formation and were ready to attack." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. V

item.name: Homarid
item.text: Homarid enters the battlefield with a tide counter on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, put a tide counter on Homarid. As long as there is exactly one tide counter on Homarid, it gets -1/-1. As long as there are exactly three tide counters on Homarid, it gets +1/+1. Whenever there are four tide counters on Homarid, remove all tide counters from it.

item.name: Homarid Shaman
item.text: {U}: Tap target green creature.
item.flavorText: "The ground grew swampy; hooves and claws sank into the marshy earth. Snarls of rage and bleats of despair echoed through the trees as the waters grew higher and higher." —Kyliki of Havenwood, "Havenwood Remembered"

item.text: {1}{U}{U}, Sacrifice a blue creature: Put X 1/1 blue Camarid creature tokens onto the battlefield, where X is the sacrificed creature's converted mana cost.

item.name: Icatian Infantry
item.text: {1}: Icatian Infantry gains first strike until end of turn. {1}: Icatian Infantry gains banding until end of turn. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
item.flavorText: "Valiant Icatia was the last of the Sarpadian empires to fall. Its faithful soldiers defended their cities to the very end." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. VI

item.name: Icatian Lieutenant
item.text: {1}{W}: Target Soldier creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: To become an officer, an Icatian Soldier had to pass a series of tests. These evaluated not only fighting and leadership skills, but also integrity, honor, and moral strength.

item.name: Icatian Moneychanger
item.text: Icatian Moneychanger enters the battlefield with three credit counters on it. When Icatian Moneychanger enters the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to you. At the beginning of your upkeep, put a credit counter on Icatian Moneychanger. Sacrifice Icatian Moneychanger: You gain 1 life for each credit counter on Icatian Moneychanger. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

item.name: Icatian Moneychanger
item.text: Icatian Moneychanger enters the battlefield with three credit counters on it. When Icatian Moneychanger enters the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to you. At the beginning of your upkeep, put a credit counter on Icatian Moneychanger. Sacrifice Icatian Moneychanger: You gain 1 life for each credit counter on Icatian Moneychanger. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

item.name: Icatian Moneychanger
item.text: Icatian Moneychanger enters the battlefield with three credit counters on it. When Icatian Moneychanger enters the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to you. At the beginning of your upkeep, put a credit counter on Icatian Moneychanger. Sacrifice Icatian Moneychanger: You gain 1 life for each credit counter on Icatian Moneychanger. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

item.name: Icatian Phalanx
item.text: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
item.flavorText: Even after the wall was breached in half a dozen places, the Phalanxes fought on, standing solidly against the onrushing raiders. Disciplined and dedicated, they held their ranks to the end, even in the face of tremendous losses.

item.name: Icatian Priest
item.text: {1}{W}{W}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "May you be strong and valiant, to defeat the enemies of the pure." —"Leitbur's Prayer"

item.name: Icatian Scout
item.text: {1}, {T}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "Of course I'm not a spy The enemy has spies. I am a Scout." —Ailis Connaut

item.name: Icatian Scout
item.text: {1}, {T}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "Of course I'm not a spy The enemy has spies. I am a Scout." —Ailis Connaut

item.name: Icatian Scout
item.text: {1}, {T}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "Of course I'm not a spy The enemy has spies. I am a Scout." —Ailis Connaut

item.name: Icatian Scout
item.text: {1}, {T}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "Of course I'm not a spy The enemy has spies. I am a Scout." —Ailis Connaut

item.name: Icatian Skirmishers
item.text: First strike; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.) Whenever Icatian Skirmishers attacks, all creatures banded with it gain first strike until end of turn.
item.flavorText: Skirmishers engaged raiders before they could reach the towns. Although these units typically suffered huge losses, they never lacked volunteers.

item.name: Icatian Store
item.text: Icatian Store enters the battlefield tapped. You may choose not to untap Icatian Store during your untap step. At the beginning of your upkeep, if Icatian Store is tapped, put a storage counter on it. {T}, Remove any number of storage counters from Icatian Store: Add {W} to your mana pool for each storage counter removed this way.

item.name: Icatian Town
item.text: Put four 1/1 white Citizen creature tokens onto the battlefield.
item.flavorText: Icatia's once peaceful towns faced increasing attacks from Orcs and Goblins as the climate cooled. By the time the empire fell, they were little more than armed camps.

item.name: Implements of Sacrifice
item.text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Implements of Sacrifice: Add two mana of any one color to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: Relics of the Order of the Ebon Hand, the bowl and dagger bespeak the hideous cruelty of its rituals.

item.name: Initiates of the Ebon Hand
item.text: {1}: Add {B} to your mana pool. If this ability has been activated four or more times this turn, sacrifice Initiates of the Ebon Hand at the beginning of the next end step.
item.flavorText: Ebon leaders soon realized that non-human races often had special talents that could be exploited.

item.name: Initiates of the Ebon Hand
item.text: {1}: Add {B} to your mana pool. If this ability has been activated four or more times this turn, sacrifice Initiates of the Ebon Hand at the beginning of the next end step.
item.flavorText: Ebon leaders soon realized that non-human races often had special talents that could be exploited.

item.name: Initiates of the Ebon Hand
item.text: {1}: Add {B} to your mana pool. If this ability has been activated four or more times this turn, sacrifice Initiates of the Ebon Hand at the beginning of the next end step.
item.flavorText: Ebon leaders soon realized that non-human races often had special talents that could be exploited.

item.name: Merseine
item.text: Enchant creature Merseine enters the battlefield with three net counters on it. Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step as long as Merseine has a net counter on it. Pay enchanted creature's mana cost: Remove a net counter from Merseine. Any player may activate this ability, but only if he or she controls the enchanted creature.

item.name: Merseine
item.text: Enchant creature Merseine enters the battlefield with three net counters on it. Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step as long as Merseine has a net counter on it. Pay enchanted creature's mana cost: Remove a net counter from Merseine. Any player may activate this ability, but only if he or she controls the enchanted creature.

item.name: Merseine
item.text: Enchant creature Merseine enters the battlefield with three net counters on it. Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step as long as Merseine has a net counter on it. Pay enchanted creature's mana cost: Remove a net counter from Merseine. Any player may activate this ability, but only if he or she controls the enchanted creature.

item.name: Merseine
item.text: Enchant creature Merseine enters the battlefield with three net counters on it. Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step as long as Merseine has a net counter on it. Pay enchanted creature's mana cost: Remove a net counter from Merseine. Any player may activate this ability, but only if he or she controls the enchanted creature.

item.name: Mindstab Thrull
item.text: Whenever Mindstab Thrull attacks and isn't blocked, you may sacrifice it. If you do, defending player discards three cards.

item.name: Mindstab Thrull
item.text: Whenever Mindstab Thrull attacks and isn't blocked, you may sacrifice it. If you do, defending player discards three cards.

item.name: Mindstab Thrull
item.text: Whenever Mindstab Thrull attacks and isn't blocked, you may sacrifice it. If you do, defending player discards three cards.

item.name: Necrite
item.text: Whenever Necrite attacks and isn't blocked, you may sacrifice it. If you do, destroy target creature defending player controls. It can't be regenerated.
item.flavorText: Was it the sight, smell, or aura of the Necrite that killed so effectively?

item.name: Necrite
item.text: Whenever Necrite attacks and isn't blocked, you may sacrifice it. If you do, destroy target creature defending player controls. It can't be regenerated.
item.flavorText: Was it the sight, smell, or aura of the Necrite that killed so effectively?

item.name: Necrite
item.text: Whenever Necrite attacks and isn't blocked, you may sacrifice it. If you do, destroy target creature defending player controls. It can't be regenerated.
item.flavorText: Was it the sight, smell, or aura of the Necrite that killed so effectively?

item.name: Night Soil
item.text: {1}, Exile two creature cards from a single graveyard: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.
item.flavorText: "There were often more Thallids after a battle than before." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. III

item.name: Night Soil
item.text: {1}, Exile two creature cards from a single graveyard: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.
item.flavorText: "There were often more Thallids after a battle than before." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. III

item.flavorText: "There were often more Thallids after a battle than before." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. III

item.name: Orcish Captain
item.text: {1}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, target Orc creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn. If you lose the flip, it gets -0/-2 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: There's a chance to win every battle.

item.name: Orcish Spy
item.text: {T}: Look at the top three cards of target player's library.
item.flavorText: "You idiot Never let the spies mingle with the Orcish regulars after completing a mission. Now we'll never get them to fight" —General Khurzog

item.name: Orcish Spy
item.text: {T}: Look at the top three cards of target player's library.
item.flavorText: "You idiot Never let the spies mingle with the Orcish regulars after completing a mission. Now we'll never get them to fight" —General Khurzog

item.text: {T}: Look at the top three cards of target player's library.
item.flavorText: "You idiot Never let the spies mingle with the Orcish regulars after completing a mission. Now we'll never get them to fight" —General Khurzog

item.name: Orcish Veteran
item.text: Orcish Veteran can't block white creatures with power 2 or greater. {R}: Orcish Veteran gains first strike until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "Orcs often greeted promotions to Icatian battle with anguished wails and pleas for mercy." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. VI

item.name: Orcish Veteran
item.text: Orcish Veteran can't block white creatures with power 2 or greater. {R}: Orcish Veteran gains first strike until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "Orcs often greeted promotions to Icatian battle with anguished wails and pleas for mercy." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. VI

item.flavorText: "Orcs often greeted promotions to Icatian battle with anguished wails and pleas for mercy." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. VI

item.name: Order of Leitbur
item.text: Protection from black {W}: Order of Leitbur gains first strike until end of turn. {W}{W}: Order of Leitbur gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "Trained to battle the followers of Tourach, the Order of Leitbur was not as successful in later conflicts with Orcish and Goblin raiders." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. I

item.name: Order of Leitbur
item.text: Protection from black {W}: Order of Leitbur gains first strike until end of turn. {W}{W}: Order of Leitbur gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "Trained to battle the followers of Tourach, the Order of Leitbur was not as successful in later conflicts with Orcish and Goblin raiders." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. I

item.name: Order of Leitbur
item.text: Protection from black {W}: Order of Leitbur gains first strike until end of turn. {W}{W}: Order of Leitbur gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "Trained to battle the followers of Tourach, the Order of Leitbur was not as successful in later conflicts with Orcish and Goblin raiders." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. I

item.name: Order of the Ebon Hand
item.text: Protection from white {B}: Order of the Ebon Hand gains first strike until end of turn. {B}{B}: Order of the Ebon Hand gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: Dedicated to the principles of Tourach, members of the Order of the Ebon Hand demonstrated their devotion with grisly rituals.

item.name: Order of the Ebon Hand
item.text: Protection from white {B}: Order of the Ebon Hand gains first strike until end of turn. {B}{B}: Order of the Ebon Hand gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: Dedicated to the principles of Tourach, members of the Order of the Ebon Hand demonstrated their devotion with grisly rituals.

item.name: Order of the Ebon Hand
item.text: Protection from white {B}: Order of the Ebon Hand gains first strike until end of turn. {B}{B}: Order of the Ebon Hand gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: Dedicated to the principles of Tourach, members of the Order of the Ebon Hand demonstrated their devotion with grisly rituals.

item.name: Orgg
item.text: Trample Orgg can't attack if defending player controls an untapped creature with power 3 or greater. Orgg can't block creatures with power 3 or greater.
item.flavorText: It's bigger than it thinks.

item.name: Raiding Party
item.text:
Raiding Party can't be the target of white spells or abilities from white sources.
Sacrifice an Orc: Each player may tap any number of untapped white creatures he or she controls. For each creature tapped this way, that player chooses up to two Plains. Then destroy all Plains that weren't chosen this way by any player.

item.name: Rainbow Vale
item.text: {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. An opponent gains control of Rainbow Vale at the beginning of the next end step.
item.flavorText: In the feudal days of Icatia, finding the Rainbow Vale was often the goal of Knights' quests.

item.name: Ring of Renewal
item.text: {5}, {T}: Discard a card at random, then draw two cards.
item.flavorText: To the uninitiated, the Ring of Renewal is merely an oddity. For those fluent in the wielding of magic, however, it is a source of great knowledge.

item.name: River Merfolk
item.text: {U}: River Merfolk gains mountainwalk until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "Dwelling in icy mountain streams near Goblin and Orcish foes, the River Merfolk were known for their stoicism." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. V

item.name: Ruins of Trokair
item.text: Ruins of Trokair enters the battlefield tapped. {T}: Add {W} to your mana pool. {T}, Sacrifice Ruins of Trokair: Add {W}{W} to your mana pool.

item.name: Sand Silos
item.text: Sand Silos enters the battlefield tapped. You may choose not to untap Sand Silos during your untap step. At the beginning of your upkeep, if Sand Silos is tapped, put a storage counter on it. {T}, Remove any number of storage counters from Sand Silos: Add {U} to your mana pool for each storage counter removed this way.

item.name: Seasinger
item.text: When you control no Islands, sacrifice Seasinger. You may choose not to untap Seasinger during your untap step. {T}: Gain control of target creature whose controller controls an Island for as long as you control Seasinger and Seasinger remains tapped.

item.name: Soul Exchange
item.text: As an additional cost to cast Soul Exchange, exile a creature you control. Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Put a +2/+2 counter on that creature if the exiled creature was a Thrull.

item.name: Spirit Shield
item.text: You may choose not to untap Spirit Shield during your untap step. {2}, {T}: Target creature gets +0/+2 for as long as Spirit Shield remains tapped.
item.flavorText: At times, survival must outweigh all other considerations.

item.name: Spore Cloud
item.text: Tap all blocking creatures. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn. Each attacking creature and each blocking creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

item.name: Spore Cloud
item.text: Tap all blocking creatures. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn. Each attacking creature and each blocking creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

item.name: Spore Cloud
item.text: Tap all blocking creatures. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn. Each attacking creature and each blocking creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

item.name: Spore Flower
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Spore Flower. Remove three spore counters from Spore Flower: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

item.name: Svyelunite Priest
item.text: {U}{U}, {T}: Target creature gains shroud until end of turn. Activate this ability only during your upkeep. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
item.flavorText: "Early Vodalians worshipped Svyelun, goddess of the Pearl Moon. Later she became a more abstract figure." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. V

item.name: Svyelunite Temple
item.text: Svyelunite Temple enters the battlefield tapped. {T}: Add {U} to your mana pool. {T}, Sacrifice Svyelunite Temple: Add {U}{U} to your mana pool.

item.name: Thallid
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Thallid. Remove three spore counters from Thallid: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.

item.name: Thallid
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Thallid. Remove three spore counters from Thallid: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.

item.name: Thallid
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Thallid. Remove three spore counters from Thallid: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.

item.name: Thallid
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Thallid. Remove three spore counters from Thallid: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.

item.name: Thallid Devourer
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Thallid Devourer. Remove three spore counters from Thallid Devourer: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield. Sacrifice a Saproling: Thallid Devourer gets +1/+2 until end of turn.

item.name: Thelonite Druid
item.text: {1}{G}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Forests you control become 2/3 creatures until end of turn. They're still lands.
item.flavorText: "The magic at the heart of all living things can bear awe-inspiring fruit." —Kolevi of Havenwood, Elder Druid

item.name: Thelonite Monk
item.text: {T}, Sacrifice a green creature: Target land becomes a Forest. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
item.flavorText: "As the climate worsened, some Thelonites turned to fertilizing with fresh blood in an attempt to keep Havenwood alive and growing." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. III

item.name: Thelon's Chant
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Thelon's Chant unless you pay {G}. Whenever a player puts a Swamp onto the battlefield, Thelon's Chant deals 3 damage to that player unless he or she puts a -1/-1 counter on a creature he or she controls.

item.name: Thelon's Curse
item.text: Blue creatures don't untap during their controllers' untap steps. At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may choose any number of tapped blue creatures he or she controls and pay {U} for each creature chosen this way. If the player does, untap those creatures.

item.name: Thorn Thallid
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Thorn Thallid. Remove three spore counters from Thorn Thallid: Thorn Thallid deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
item.flavorText: "I don't know which is worse, getting hit with those darts or having to watch them grow back." —Orcish Soldier

item.name: Thorn Thallid
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Thorn Thallid. Remove three spore counters from Thorn Thallid: Thorn Thallid deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
item.flavorText: "I don't know which is worse, getting hit with those darts or having to watch them grow back." —Orcish Soldier

item.name: Thorn Thallid
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Thorn Thallid. Remove three spore counters from Thorn Thallid: Thorn Thallid deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
item.flavorText: "I don't know which is worse, getting hit with those darts or having to watch them grow back." —Orcish Soldier

item.name: Thorn Thallid
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Thorn Thallid. Remove three spore counters from Thorn Thallid: Thorn Thallid deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
item.flavorText: "I don't know which is worse, getting hit with those darts or having to watch them grow back." —Orcish Soldier

item.name: Thrull Champion
item.text: Thrull creatures get +1/+1. {T}: Gain control of target Thrull for as long as you control Thrull Champion.
item.flavorText: "Those idiots should never have bred Thrulls for combat" —Jherana Rure

item.name: Thrull Retainer
item.text: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets +1/+1. Sacrifice Thrull Retainer: Regenerate enchanted creature.
item.flavorText: "Until the Rebellion, Thrulls served their masters faithfully—even at the cost of their own lives." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. II

item.name: Thrull Wizard
item.text: {1}{B}: Counter target black spell unless that spell's controller pays {B} or {3}.
item.flavorText: "In crafting intelligent Thrulls to assist in sacrifices, Sahr inadvertantly set the stage for the Thrull Rebellion." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. II

item.name: Tidal Flats
item.text: {U}{U}: For each attacking creature without flying, its controller may pay {1}. If he or she doesn't, creatures you control blocking that creature gain first strike until end of turn.

item.name: Tidal Flats
item.text: {U}{U}: For each attacking creature without flying, its controller may pay {1}. If he or she doesn't, creatures you control blocking that creature gain first strike until end of turn.

item.name: Tidal Flats
item.text: {U}{U}: For each attacking creature without flying, its controller may pay {1}. If he or she doesn't, creatures you control blocking that creature gain first strike until end of turn.

item.name: Tidal Influence
item.text: Cast Tidal Influence only if no permanents named Tidal Influence are on the battlefield. Tidal Influence enters the battlefield with a tide counter on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, put a tide counter on Tidal Influence. As long as there is exactly one tide counter on Tidal Influence, all blue creatures get -2/-0. As long as there are exactly three tide counters on Tidal Influence, all blue creatures get +2/+0. Whenever there are four tide counters on Tidal Influence, remove all tide counters from it.

item.name: Tourach's Chant
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Tourach's Chant unless you pay {B}. Whenever a player puts a Forest onto the battlefield, Tourach's Chant deals 3 damage to that player unless he or she puts a -1/-1 counter on a creature he or she controls.

item.name: Tourach's Gate
item.text: Enchant land you control Sacrifice a Thrull: Put three time counters on Tourach's Gate. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter from Tourach's Gate. If there are no time counters on Tourach's Gate, sacrifice it. Enchanted land has "{T}: Attacking creatures you control get +2/-1 until end of turn."

item.name: Vodalian Knights
item.text: First strike Vodalian Knights can't attack unless defending player controls an Island. When you control no Islands, sacrifice Vodalian Knights. {U}: Vodalian Knights gains flying until end of turn.
item.flavorText: Fear the Knight leaping from the water into the air, weapon ready.

item.name: Vodalian Mage
item.text: {U}, {T}: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
item.flavorText: "Come back, cowards Everyone knows Merfolk can't wield magic"Pashadar Dirf, Goblin Flotilla Commander, last words

item.name: Vodalian Mage
item.text: {U}, {T}: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
item.flavorText: "Come back, cowards Everyone knows Merfolk can't wield magic"Pashadar Dirf, Goblin Flotilla Commander, last words

item.name: Vodalian Mage
item.text: {U}, {T}: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
item.flavorText: "Come back, cowards Everyone knows Merfolk can't wield magic"Pashadar Dirf, Goblin Flotilla Commander, last words

item.name: Vodalian Soldiers
item.flavorText: "You think you know everything there is to know about battle? You know Orc droppings Underwater combat is three dimensional. Those thrice-damned Vodalians don't attack in ranks; they attack in schools." —Ivra Jursdotter

item.name: Vodalian Soldiers
item.flavorText: "You think you know everything there is to know about battle? You know Orc droppings Underwater combat is three dimensional. Those thrice-damned Vodalians don't attack in ranks; they attack in schools." —Ivra Jursdotter

item.name: Vodalian Soldiers
item.flavorText: "You think you know everything there is to know about battle? You know Orc droppings Underwater combat is three dimensional. Those thrice-damned Vodalians don't attack in ranks; they attack in schools." —Ivra Jursdotter

item.name: Vodalian Soldiers
item.flavorText: "You think you know everything there is to know about battle? You know Orc droppings Underwater combat is three dimensional. Those thrice-damned Vodalians don't attack in ranks; they attack in schools." —Ivra Jursdotter

item.name: Vodalian War Machine
item.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.) Tap an untapped Merfolk you control: Vodalian War Machine can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender. Tap an untapped Merfolk you control: Vodalian War Machine gets +2/+1 until end of turn. When Vodalian War Machine is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, destroy all Merfolk tapped this turn to pay for its abilities.

item.name: Zelyon Sword
item.text: You may choose not to untap Zelyon Sword during your untap step. {3}, {T}: Target creature gets +2/+0 for as long as Zelyon Sword remains tapped.
item.flavorText: No sheath shall hold what finds its home in flesh.
